flawed_nl_solution:
If yesterday the number of buyers was half the number of buyers the day before, then yesterday there were 1/2*50 = <<1/2*50=100/1>>100/1 buyers.
Today has 40 more buyers than yesterday, so there were 40+100/1 = <<40+100/1=140>>140 buyers today.
The total number of buyers in the store for the three days will be 140+100/1+50 = <<140+100/1+50=290>>290 buyers

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 25, not 100/1. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
